intro: Lycianthes stellata var. puberula, commonly known as the hairy starapple, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and hairy leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, round fruits that are often used in local cuisines. The botanical features of this plant make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
